member.name: T:Microsoft.Owin.Security.ApiKey.ApiKeyAuthenticationMiddleware
member.summary: OWIN authentication middleware to enable authentication of requests using an API key in the request's header.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.ApiKey.ApiKeyAuthenticationMiddleware.#ctor(Microsoft.Owin.OwinMiddleware,Owin.IAppBuilder,Microsoft.Owin.Security.ApiKey.ApiKeyAuthenticationOptions)
member.summary: API key authentication middleware component which is added to an OWIN pipeline. This constructor is not called by application code directly, instead it is added by calling the IAppBuilder UseApiKeyAuthentication extension method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.ApiKey.ApiKeyAuthenticationMiddleware.CreateHandler
member.summary: Called by the AuthenticationMiddleware base class to create a per-request handler.
member.returns: A new instance of the request handler

member.name: T:Microsoft.Owin.Security.ApiKey.ApiKeyAuthenticationOptions
member.summary: Options which control the behaviour of the authentication middleware.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Owin.Security.ApiKey.ApiKeyAuthenticationOptions.Provider
member.summary: The object provided by the application to process events raised by the API key authentication middleware. The application must create an instance of ApiKeyAuthenticationProvider and assign delegates to the mandatory events.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.ApiKey.ApiKeyAuthenticationOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance of API key authentication options with default values.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.ApiKey.ApiKeyAuthenticationOptions.Header
member.summary:
The header that shall contain the authentication data. Defaults to "Authorization".
An example header using the defaults would be:
Authorization: ApiKey 4fb4e33c83e5d026e8745102b72f10590f48e94af107db15074c799589a4753d

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.ApiKey.ApiKeyAuthenticationOptions.HeaderKey
member.summary:
The key of the key/value pair that represents the authentication type and its data. Defaults to "ApiKey".
An example header using the defaults would be:
Authorization: ApiKey 4fb4e33c83e5d026e8745102b72f10590f48e94af107db15074c799589a4753d

member.name: T:Microsoft.Owin.Security.ApiKey.ApiKeyAuthenticationProvider
member.summary: Default implementation of ApiKeyAuthenticationProvider used by the API key authentication middleware to communicate with the web application while processing requests. ApiKeyAuthenticationProvider provides some default behaviour, may be used as a virtual base class, and offers delegate properties which may be used to handle individual calls without declaring a new class type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.ApiKey.ApiKeyAuthenticationProvider.OnGenerateClaims
member.summary: Called to generate a set of claims to represent the user to whom the provided API key belongs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.ApiKey.ApiKeyAuthenticationProvider.OnValidateIdentity
member.summary: Called to validate that the API key supplied with the request is considered by your application to be a valid API key. The application MUST implement this call.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.ApiKey.ApiKeyAuthenticationProvider.GenerateClaims(Microsoft.Owin.Security.ApiKey.Contexts.ApiKeyGenerateClaimsContext)
member.summary: Implements the interface method by invoking the related delegate method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.ApiKey.ApiKeyAuthenticationProvider.ValidateIdentity(Microsoft.Owin.Security.ApiKey.Contexts.ApiKeyValidateIdentityContext)
member.summary: Implements the interface method by invoking the related delegate method.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Owin.Security.ApiKey.Contexts.ApiKeyContextBase
member.summary: Contains data about the API key provided with the request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.ApiKey.Contexts.ApiKeyContextBase.ApiKey
member.summary: The API key supplied with the request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.ApiKey.Contexts.ApiKeyContextBase.HasError
member.summary: Should be set to true if any errors have been generated when building the context.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Owin.Security.ApiKey.Contexts.ApiKeyGenerateClaimsContext
member.summary: Contains data about the API key provided with the request in order to construct an identity for the requester.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Owin.Security.ApiKey.Contexts.ApiKeyValidateIdentityContext
member.summary: Contains data about the API key provided with the request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.ApiKey.Contexts.ApiKeyValidateIdentityContext.IsValidated
member.summary: True if application code has called any of the Validate methods on this context.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.ApiKey.Contexts.ApiKeyValidateIdentityContext.StatusCode
member.summary: The HTTP status code to use when responding to the client. This is only used if the context is not validated, i.e. the user is not authenticated.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.ApiKey.Contexts.ApiKeyValidateIdentityContext.Validate
member.summary: Marks this context as validated by the application. IsValidated becomes true and HasError becomes false as a result of calling.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Owin.Security.ApiKey.IAppBuilderExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods to add API key authentication capabilities to an OWIN pipeline.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.ApiKey.IAppBuilderExtensions.UseApiKeyAuthentication(Owin.IAppBuilder,Microsoft.Owin.Security.ApiKey.ApiKeyAuthenticationOptions)
member.summary: Configures an Owin application to use API key authentication; the API key should be provided in the authorization header on every request, e.g. 'Authorization: ApiKey 123'.
member.param: Options which control the behaviour of the authentication middleware
